intro: Aquilegia lactiflora, commonly known as the milk vetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant produces clusters of delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three heart-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Aquilegia lactiflora is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cooler climates.
